books.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew

chapters.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:1
verses.text: Acts of Peter and Andrew: Acts of the Holy Apostles Peter and Andrew.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:2
verses.text: It came to pass when Andrew the apostle of Christ went forth from the city of the man-eaters, behold a luminous cloud snatched him up, and carried him away to the mountain where Peter and Matthew and Alexander were sitting.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:3
verses.text: And when he saw them, they saluted him with great joy.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:4
verses.text: Then Peter says to him:  What has happened to thee, brother Andrew?  Hast thou sown the word of truth in the country of the man-eaters or not?  Andrew says to him:  Yes, father Peter, through thy prayers; but the men of that city have done me many mischiefs, for they dragged me through their street three days, so that my blood stained the whole street.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:5
verses.text: Peter says to him:  Be a man in the Lord, brother Andrew, and come hither, and rest from thy labour.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:6
verses.text: For if the good husbandman laboriously till the ground, it will also bear fruit, and straightway all his toil will be turned into joy; but if he toil, and his land bring forth no fruit, he has double toil.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:7
verses.text: And while he was thus speaking, the Lord Jesus Christ appeared to them in the form of a child, and said to them:  Hail, Peter, bishop of the whole of my Church! hail, Andrew!  My co-heirs, be courageous, and struggle for mankind; for verily I say unto you, you shall endure toils in this world for mankind.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:8
verses.text: But be bold; I will give you rest in one hour of repose in the kingdom of my Father.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:9
verses.text: Arise, then, and go into the city of the barbarians, and preach in it; and I will be with you in the wonders that shall happen in it by your hands.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:10
verses.text: And the Lord Jesus, after saluting them, went up into the heavens in glory.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:11
verses.text: And Peter, and Andrew, and Alexander, and Rufus, and Matthias, went into the city of the barbarians.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:12
verses.text: And after they had come near the city, Andrew answered and said to Peter:  Father Peter, have we again to undergo toils in this city, as in the country of the man-eaters?  Peter says to him:  I do not know.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:13
verses.text: But, behold, there is an old man before us sowing in his field:  if we go up to him, let us say to him, Give us bread; and if he give us bread, we may know that we are not to suffer in this city; but if he say to us, We have no bread, on the other hand, we shall know that suffering again awaits us.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:14
verses.text: And when they came up to the old man, Peter says to him:  Hail, farmer!  And the farmer says to them:  Hail you too, merchants!  Peter says to him:  Have you bread to give to these children, for we have been in want?  The old man says to them:  Wait a little, and look after the oxen, and the plough, and the land, that I may go into the city, and get you loaves.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:15
verses.text: Peter says to him:  If you provide hospitality for us, we shall took after the cattle and the field.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:16
verses.text: The old man says:  So be it.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:17
verses.text: Peter says to him:  Are the oxen your own?  The old man says:  No; I have them on hire.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:18
verses.text: Peter says to him:  Go into the city.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:19
verses.text: And the old man went into the city.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:20
verses.text: And Peter arose, and girded up his cloak and his under-garment, and says to Andrew:  It is not right for us to rest and be idle; above all, when the old man is working for us, having left his own work.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:21
verses.text: Then Peter took hold of the plough, and sowed the wheat.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:22
verses.text: And Andrew was behind the oxen, and says to Peter:  Father Peter, why dost thou bring toil upon us, especially when we have work enough already!  Then Andrew took the plough out of Peter's hand, and sowed the wheat, saying:  O seed cast into the ground in the field of the righteous, come up, and come to the light.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:23
verses.text: Let the young men of the city therefore come forth, whom I found in the pit of destruction until to-day; for, behold, the apostles of Christ are coming into the city, pardoning the sins of those who believe in them, and healing every disease, and every sickness.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:24
verses.text: Pray ye for me, that He may have mercy upon me, and that I may be delivered from this strait.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:25
verses.text: And many of the multitude believed in Christ, because of the saying of the woman; and they fell at the feet of the apostles, and adored them.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:26
verses.text: And they laid their hands upon them.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:27
verses.text: And they healed those in the city that were sick, and gave sight to the blind and, hearing to the deaf, and drove out the demons.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:28
verses.text: All the multitude glorified the Father, and the Son, and the Holy Spirit.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:29
verses.text: And there was a certain rich man in the city, by name Onesiphorus.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:30
verses.text: He, having seen the miracles done by the apostles, says to them:  If I believe in your God, can I also do a miracle like you?  Andrew says to him:  If thou wilt forsake all that belongs to thee, and thy wife and thy children, as we also have done, then thou also shalt do miracles.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:31
verses.text: When Onesiphorus heard this, he was filled with rage, and took his scarf and threw it over Andrew's neck, and struck him, and said to him:  Thou art a sorcerer.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:32
verses.text: How dost thou force me to abandon my wife, and my children, and my goods?  Then Peter, having turned and seen him striking Andrew, says to him:  Man, stop now striking Andrew.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:33
verses.text: Onesiphorus says to him:  I see that thou art more sensible than he.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:34
verses.text: Do thou then tell me to leave my wife, and my children, and my goods.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:35
verses.text: What dost thou say?  Peter says to him:  One thing I say unto thee:  it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle, than for a rich man to go into the kingdom of heaven.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:36
verses.text: When Onesiphorus heard this, he was even more filled with rage and anger, and took his scarf off the neck of Andrew, and threw it upon the neck of Peter; and so he dragged him along, saying:  Verily thou art a great sorcerer, more than the other; for a camel cannot go through the eye of a needle.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:37
verses.text: But if thou wilt show me this miracle, I will believe in thy God; and not only I, but also the whole city.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:38
verses.text: But if not, thou shalt be grievously punished in the midst of the city.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:39
verses.text: And when Peter heard this, he was exceedingly grieved, and stood and stretched forth his hands towards heaven, and prayed, saying:  O Lord our God, listen to me at this time; for they will ensnare us from Thine own words:  for no prophet has spoken to set forth this his explanation, and no patriarch that we might learn the interpretation of it; and now we seek for ourselves the explanation with boldness.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:40
verses.text: Do Thou then, Lord, not overlook us:  for thou art He who is praised by the cherubim.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:41
verses.text: And after he had said this, the Saviour appeared in the form of a child of twelve years old, wearing a linen garment; and He says to them:  Be courageous, and tremble not, my chosen disciples; for I am with you always.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:42
verses.text: Let the needle and the camel be brought.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:43
verses.text: And after saying this, He went up into the heavens.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:44
verses.text: And there was a certain merchant in the city who had believed in the Lord through the Apostle Philip; and when he heard of this, he ran and searched for a needle with a big eye, to do a favour to the apostles.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:45
verses.text: When Peter learned this, he said:  My son, do not search for a big needle; for nothing is impossible with God:  rather bring us a small needle.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:46
verses.text: And after the needle had been brought, and all the multitude of the city were standing by to see, Peter looked up and saw a camel coming.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:47
verses.text: And he ordered her to be brought.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:48
verses.text: Then he fixed the needle in the ground, and cried out with a loud voice, saying:  In the name of Jesus Christ, who was crucified under Pontius Pilate, I order thee, O camel, to go through the eye of the needle.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:49
verses.text: Then the eye of the needle was opened like a gate, and the camel went through it, and all the multitude saw it.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:50
verses.text: Again Peter says to the camel:  Go again through the needle.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:51
verses.text: And the camel went a second time.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:52
verses.text: When Onesiphorus saw this, he said to Peter; Truly thou art a great sorcerer; but I do not believe unless I send and bring a camel and a needle.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:53
verses.text: And he called one of his servants, and said to him privately:  Go and bring me here a camel and a needle; find also a polluted woman, and force her to come here:  for these men are sorcerers.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:54
verses.text: And Peter having learned the mystery through the Spirit, says to Onesiphorus:  Send and bring the camel, and the woman, and the needle.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:55
verses.text: And when they brought them, Peter took the needle, and fixed it in the ground.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:56
verses.text: And the woman was sitting on the camel.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:57
verses.text: Then Peter says:  In the name of our Lord Jesus Christ the crucified, I order thee, O camel, to go through this needle.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:58
verses.text: And immediately the eye of the needle was opened, and became like a gate, and the camel went through it.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:59
verses.text: Peter again says to the camel:  Go through it again, that all may see the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ, in order that some may believe on Him.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:60
verses.text: Then the camel again went through the needle.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:61
verses.text: And Onesiphorus seeing it, cried out, and said:  Truly great is the God of Peter and Andrew, and I from this time forth believe in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:62
verses.text: Now then, hear my words, O Peter.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:63
verses.text: I have corn lands, vineyards, and fields; I have also twenty-seven pounds of gold, and fifty pounds of silver; and I have very many slaves.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:64
verses.text: I give my possessions to the poor, that I also may do one miracle like you.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:65
verses.text: And Peter was grieved lest the powers should not work in him, seeing that he had not received the seal in Christ.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:66
verses.text: And while he was considering this, behold, a voice out of the heaven saying to him:  Do to him what he wishes, because I will accomplish for him what he desires.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:67
verses.text: Peter says to him:  My son, come hither; do as we do.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:68

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Peter and Andrew 1:69
verses.text: ends.
